definition: to comment/a point by point commentary
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The influence of he to posterity is clear.
sentences.chinese: 金圣叹的评点对后人的影响也是显而易见的。

sentences.english: The document theory in Dexiu-Zhen's annotation deserves to research deeply.
sentences.chinese: 真氏评点中的公文理论值得我们深入探讨。

sentences.english: Chapter four is about the specific critique to Zhouwengui and the influence on the later generation.
sentences.chinese: 第四章《周文归》的文章评点及对后世的影响。

sentences.english: Lizhi is a literature critic of the Chinese classical literature.
sentences.chinese: 李贽是中国古典文学的评点家。

sentences.english: The opening significance of Liu's novel annotations can not be overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 刘氏小说评点在修辞学史上的开创意义不容忽视。

definition: to critique/to voice concerns about/ancient form of acupuncture using sharp stones as needles
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
understanding and enjoying (a work of art)
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
